user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of create_response_object:
```c
static struct MHD_Response *
create_response_object (void)
{
#if MHD_VERSION >= 0x00097701
  if (NULL != body_dyn)
    return MHD_create_response_from_buffer_static (body_dyn_size,
                                                   body_dyn);
  else if (tool_params.empty)
    return MHD_create_response_empty (MHD_RF_NONE);

  return MHD_create_response_from_buffer_static (MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (tiny_body),
                                                 tiny_body);

#else  /* MHD_VERSION < 0x00097701 */
  if (NULL != body_dyn)
    return MHD_create_response_from_buffer (body_dyn_size,
                                            (void *) body_dyn,
                                            MHD_RESPMEM_PERSISTENT);
  else if (tool_params.empty)
    return MHD_create_response_from_buffer (0,
                                            (void *) tiny_body,
                                            MHD_RESPMEM_PERSISTENT);

  return MHD_create_response_from_buffer (MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (tiny_body),
                                          (void *) tiny_body,
                                          MHD_RESPMEM_PERSISTENT);
#endif /* MHD_VERSION < 0x00097701 */
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function create_response_object:
_MHD_EXTERN struct MHD_Response *
MHD_create_response_from_buffer_static (size_t size,
                                        const void *buffer)
{
  return MHD_create_response_from_buffer_with_free_callback_cls (size,
                                                                 buffer,
                                                                 NULL,
                                                                 NULL);
}
...
_MHD_EXTERN struct MHD_Response *
MHD_create_response_from_buffer (size_t size,
                                 void *buffer,
                                 enum MHD_ResponseMemoryMode mode)
{
  if (MHD_RESPMEM_MUST_FREE == mode)
    return MHD_create_response_from_buffer_with_free_callback_cls (size,
                                                                   buffer,
                                                                   &free,
                                                                   buffer);
  if (MHD_RESPMEM_MUST_COPY == mode)
    return MHD_create_response_from_buffer_copy (size,
                                                 buffer);

  return MHD_create_response_from_buffer_with_free_callback_cls (size,
                                                                 buffer,
                                                                 NULL,
                                                                 NULL);
}
...
_MHD_EXTERN struct MHD_Response *
MHD_create_response_empty (enum MHD_ResponseFlags flags)
{
  struct MHD_Response *r;
  r = (struct MHD_Response *) MHD_calloc_ (1, sizeof (struct MHD_Response));
  if (NULL != r)
  {
    if (MHD_mutex_init_ (&r->mutex))
    {
      r->fd = -1;
      r->reference_count = 1;
      /* If any flags combination will be not allowed, replace the next
       * assignment with MHD_set_response_options() call. */
      r->flags = flags;

      return r; /* Successful result */
    }
    free (r);
  }
  return NULL; /* Something failed */
}
...
_MHD_EXTERN struct MHD_Response *
MHD_create_response_from_buffer_with_free_callback_cls (size_t size,
                                                        const void *buffer,
                                                        MHD_ContentReaderFreeCallback
                                                        crfc,
                                                        void *crfc_cls)
{
  struct MHD_Response *r;

  if ((NULL == buffer) && (size > 0))
    return NULL;
#if SIZEOF_SIZE_T >= SIZEOF_UINT64_T
  if (MHD_SIZE_UNKNOWN == size)
    return NULL;
#endif /* SIZEOF_SIZE_T >= SIZEOF_UINT64_T */
  r = MHD_calloc_ (1, sizeof (struct MHD_Response));
  if (NULL == r)
    return NULL;
#if defined(MHD_USE_THREADS)
  if (! MHD_mutex_init_ (&r->mutex))
  {
    free (r);
    return NULL;
  }
#endif
  r->fd = -1;
  r->reference_count = 1;
  r->total_size = size;
  r->data = buffer;
  r->data_size = size;
  r->crfc = crfc;
  r->crc_cls = crfc_cls;
  return r;
}
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
No suspicious fragments found. Reasoning:
- create_response_object does not contain any call to itself; it only returns the result of helper functions (MHD_create_response_from_buffer_static, MHD_create_response_empty, MHD_create_response_from_buffer).
- The provided definitions of the called helpers do not call create_response_object: MHD_create_response_from_buffer_static delegates to MHD_create_response_from_buffer_with_free_callback_cls; MHD_create_response_empty allocates and returns a struct; MHD_create_response_from_buffer either delegates to MHD_create_response_from_buffer_with_free_callback_cls, to MHD_create_response_from_buffer_copy, or sets up free as the callback. None of these call create_response_object.
- The callback parameter (crfc) passed in the shown call paths is either NULL or &free; neither can invoke create_response_object.
- Conditional compilation (MHD_VERSION branches) only selects which helper is called; it does not introduce any recursion.
- No function pointers or indirections in the shown code paths can lead back to create_response_object.

Because none of the called functions (as shown) invoke create_response_object either directly or indirectly, there is no evidence of recursion and no fragments require further investigation under MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2.
